msbt.message: I love the horns on horned dynastids, but the silhouette of their legs is sooooooo on point.
Finding a giant stag gets me SO psyched! It's one of my fave things about summer.
The jagged horns on saw stags are le bonkers. But be careful not to get pinched, though
Horned hercules are all about that straight, glossy horn! Must take forever to get ready in the morning!
The mantis is bad at flying, but it still looks legit "fashion show" when its wings are spread!
I totes want an accessory that looks like a Madagascan sunset moth! It'd be SO chic-tastic!
The scarab beetle is so sparkly. I'm a total sucker for sparkly.
Ooh, the great purple emperor! I L-O-V-E love those bright colors! So handsome and regal!
I want to be a mysterious lady with layers of mystery. Like how the jewel beetle's colors are layered!
The agrias butterfly is born with those FAB colors! I'm sooo jelly. I want to be colorful!
I love it when the light catches the emperor butterfly's wings! It's like a sparkly blue gem!
A firefly's light is so soft and très romantic<10_4 />even if it is a butt light.
The Atlas moth so rocks the translucent look with those wings! Mesh is soooooo in right now.
Al-ex-an-d-rabird? This name is WAY too long! Guess that makes sense for the biggest butterfly!
Check it. Scorpions? Legit dancers. I'd challenge one to a dance off, but I don't want it to get mad when I win.
I love how chic the wasp's whole ènsèmbèlè is. But I am SO not about that sting!
This bug is so small and cuuute!<10_4 /> Oh, it's a firefly?! It looks so different at night, !
Look at the freaky pattern on the man-faced stink bug! It looks like a face-creature with feet!
The walking leaf is SO adorbs! Her leaf-dress silhouette is an abso<10_5 />lute showstopper!

So, I guess the bell cricket's singing skills are, like, off the charts. But I don't hear anything now.For an entertainer like myself, hearing crickets is usually a bad sign. So I must be doing something right!
If you look reeeaaally close at a cicada shell, you'll see teeeny little hairs they missed while shaving!
"Rosalia batesi" sounds both fancy and schmancy! Their fluffy black antennae are so cute too!
The damselfly looks like a little baby dragonfly! I want to scream, but that would scare them. I am not going to scare the cute baby buggy.
Mosquitos? Ugh! I'm super into bugs, but those guys aren't bugs. They're just tiny flying Draculas!
That was YOUR catch, ? That's AMAZING! I got to see one up close because of you! It's SO much better than seeing one in a book!
OHMIGOSH! I can't believe I get to see a bug battle in real life!
